intro: Oreomecon miyabeana, commonly known as Japanese rock lettuce, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are often edible and have a slightly bitter taste, making it a traditional food in some regions.
